title: Front Sprocket - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Notice - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork.
Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Front Sprocket Removal - DW; DW4; DWB
Position the motorcycle on the side stand.
Remove the lock nuts and detach the coolant expansion tank from its mounting. Discard the lock nuts.
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Remove the lock nut and detach the rear brake fluid reservoir from the coolant expansion tank mounting plate and position aside. Discard the lock nut.
Secure the rear brake fluid reservoir in an upright position.
Release the fixings and remove the coolant expansion tank mounting.

body.name: Coolant Expansion Tank Mount DW L0213_1

body.body: Bend back the front sprocket lock washer.
Have an assistant sit on the motorcycle, select sixth gear and apply the front and rear brakes hard.

body.name: Fit new lock washer front sprocket abni_2

body.body: Remove the front sprocket nut and discard the lock washer.
Loosen the drive chain and remove it from the front sprocket (see
Note the orientation of the front sprocket for installation.
Slide the front sprocket off the output shaft.
